result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Z. Ricke

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 11:12 AM: 21CF664, 21CF893, 21CF1148, 22CF451.
Defendant Jacob Z. Ricke in custody and in court with Attorney Zebulon Patek.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights.  Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
21CF893: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Possession of Methamphetamine; Repeater.  
21CF1148: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine; Repeater. Repeaters acknowledged.
Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 2 years of Probation with the following conditions:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.  AODA and follow through with recommendations, 90 Days Jail (Court finds the Defendant eligible for Huber) are stayed pending further order of court (Count 1 in 21CF1148), Court Costs/surcharges, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge, Contraband ordered destroyed.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Defendant is granted 13 days credit in 21CF1148 and 14 days credit in 21CF893.
Plea hearing on April 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(Cases 21CF664, 21CF893, 21CF1148, 22CF451 are called at 2:03 PM) Defendant Jacob Z. Ricke in court, in custody.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Jacob Z. Ricke. Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is a waiver and an agreement today. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in all cases. Defense requests to be heard on the plea today. 
Court advises counsel to schedule with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant. 
Plea Hearing to be scheduled with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(11:18 AM cases 21CF664, 21CF893, 21CF1148, 22CF451 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob Z. Ricke appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared by video for Jacob Z. Ricke.
Court orders warrants are quashed.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint in 22CF451.
State requests $2,000.00 cash bond to cover all cases and cites reasoning. Attorney Patek requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond with conditions to cover all cases.
Attorney Patek moves to dismiss count 3 of the complaint in 22CF451. State opposes the motion to dismiss and provides argument. Court denies motion to dismiss.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF451, 21CF664, 21CF893, 21CF1148)
